speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: SCENE III. Juliet's chamber.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Enter JULIET and Nurse

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Ay, those attires are best: but, gentle nurse,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I pray thee, leave me to my self to-night,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: For I have need of many orisons

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To move the heavens to smile upon my state,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Which, well thou know'st, is cross, and full of sin.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Enter LADY CAPULET

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: What, are you busy, ho? need you my help?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: No, madam; we have cull'd such necessaries

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: As are behoveful for our state to-morrow:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: So please you, let me now be left alone,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And let the nurse this night sit up with you;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: For, I am sure, you have your hands full all,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: In this so sudden business.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Good night:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Get thee to bed, and rest; for thou hast need.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Exeunt LADY CAPULET and Nurse

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That almost freezes up the heat of life:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I'll call them back again to comfort me:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Nurse! What should she do here?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: My dismal scene I needs must act alone.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Come, vial.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What if this mixture do not work at all?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Shall I be married then to-morrow morning?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: No, no: this shall forbid it: lie thou there.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Laying down her dagger

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What if it be a poison, which the friar

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Subtly hath minister'd to have me dead,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Lest in this marriage he should be dishonour'd,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Because he married me before to Romeo?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I fear it is: and yet, methinks, it should not,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: For he hath still been tried a holy man.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: How if, when I am laid into the tomb,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I wake before the time that Romeo

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Come to redeem me? there's a fearful point!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Shall I not, then, be stifled in the vault,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To whose foul mouth no healthsome air breathes in,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And there die strangled ere my Romeo comes?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Or, if I live, is it not very like,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: The horrible conceit of death and night,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Together with the terror of the place,--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: As in a vault, an ancient receptacle,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Where, for these many hundred years, the bones

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Of all my buried ancestors are packed:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Where bloody Tybalt, yet but green in earth,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Lies festering in his shroud; where, as they say,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: At some hours in the night spirits resort;--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Alack, alack, is it not like that I,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: So early waking, what with loathsome smells,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And shrieks like mandrakes' torn out of the earth,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That living mortals, hearing them, run mad:--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, if I wake, shall I not be distraught,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Environed with all these hideous fears?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And madly play with my forefather's joints?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And pluck the mangled Tybalt from his shroud?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And, in this rage, with some great kinsman's bone,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: As with a club, dash out my desperate brains?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, look! methinks I see my cousin's ghost

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Seeking out Romeo, that did spit his body

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Upon a rapier's point: stay, Tybalt, stay!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Romeo, I come! this do I drink to thee.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: She falls upon her bed, within the curtains
